It may be used freely by individuals for research, teaching, and personal use as long as this statement of availability is included in the text. For all other use contact the Special Collections Librarian, Hoskins Library, University of Tennessee, 1401 Cumberland Avenue, Knoxville, TN 37996. (865) 974-4480.

bibl.title: [Receipt] 1808 Jul. 26, United States to James Carey / Return J. Meigs
bibl.author: Meigs, Return Jonathan
bibl.note: This document is a receipt for payment of sixteen dollars and twenty-five cents to James Carey for building expenses. Return J. Meigs, agent for the War Department in Tennessee made the payment on behalf of the United States.

projectDesc.p: Created for the University of Tennessee Digital Library

editorialDecl.p: Quotation marks retained as data except inside q tags
Errors in transcription of the printed text controlled with X-Metal 2.1 spell-checker; text has also been thoroughly proofread.
Corrections and normalization represented by editorial tags.
Catchwords and directional notes such as "turn page over" have been omitted.

refsDecl.p: ID attributes provided for only those pages, chapters, or illustrations toward which a reference or figure points.

div1.opener:
The United States
1808 To James Carey (Interpreter)__ Dr.
div1.p:
To the following articles of expense in building a Cabbin for his residence near the Factory viz.
To cutting logs for the cabbin---3.00
To Team work drawing the logs & stone-2.00
To 10 lb nails at 20 cts-------2.00
To cash paid for labour building the cabbin2.00
To 2 gallons whiskey for raising the cabbin2.00
To 300 feet of Boards 125 cts pr hundred--3.75
to 2 pr Hinges at 75 cts---------1.50
―
$16.25Received of Return J. Meigs sixteen dollars, twenty five cents in full payment for the above account. Highwassee 26th July 1808_
